class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.BetaILOFController(nu, ny, hidden_layers, act_f='relu', nd=None, lip=None)[source]

Bases: ILOFController

Inverse of a Linearizing Output Feedback (ILOF) controller with a Beta decoupling matrix function.

\[v = \beta(y)(u + alpha(y))\]

with \(\beta\) is invertible.

Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • hidden_layers (List[int])

  • act_f (str)

  • nd (int | None)

  • lip (float | Tensor | None)

clone()[source]

Clone the Beta ILOF controller.

Returns:

A new instance of the Beta ILOF controller with the same parameters.

Return type:

BetaILOFController

forward(u, y, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the Beta ILOF controller.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu).

  • y (Tensor) – Output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny).

  • d (Optional[Tensor]) – Disturbance tensor of shape (batch_size, nd). Defaults to None.

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (batch_size, nu), which is the new virtual input.

Return type:

Tensor

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.BetaILSFController(nu, nx, hidden_layers, act_f='relu', nd=None, lip=None)[source]

Bases: ILSFController

Inverse of a Linearizing State Feedback (ILSF) controller with a Beta decoupling matrix function.

\[v = \beta(x)(u + alpha(x))\]

with \(\beta\) is invertible.

Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • nx (int)

  • hidden_layers (List[int])

  • act_f (str)

  • nd (int | None)

  • lip (float | Tensor | None)

clone()[source]

Clone the Beta ILSF controller.

Returns:

A new instance of the Beta ILSF controller with the same parameters.

Return type:

BetaILSFController

forward(u, x, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the Beta ILSF controller.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu).

  • x (Tensor) – State tensor of shape (batch_size, nx).

  • d (Optional[Tensor]) – Disturbance tensor of shape (batch_size, nd). Defaults to None.

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (batch_size, nu), which is the new virtual input.

Return type:

Tensor

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.ExoH2Linear(nu, ny, nx, nd, gamma_2)[source]

Bases: ExoSSLinear

Create a linear continuous-time state-space model with a prescribed H2 norm and disturbance. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + Gd \\
y &= Cx + Du
Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • nx (int)

  • nd (int)

  • gamma_2 (float)

nu

Number of inputs.

Type:

int

ny

Number of outputs.

Type:

int

nx

Number of states.

Type:

int

nd
Type:

int

gamma_2

Prescribed H2 norm.

Type:

float

clone()[source]

Clone the model, it has to be implemented to be compliant with simulator classes.

classmethod copy(model)[source]

This class method returns a copy of a given H2bounded model.

We have to do this trick since self is not usable due to geotorch. Indeed when an object has parameterized attributes its class changes.

Return type:

ExoH2Linear

Parameters:

model (ExoH2Linear)

forward(u, x, d)[source]
Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu)

  • x (Tensor) – state tensor of shape (batch_size, nx)

  • d (Tensor) – exogenous input tensor of shape (batch_size, nd)

Returns:

state derivative tensor of shape (batch_size, nx) y (Tensor): output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny)

Return type:

dx (Tensor)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, G0, gamma2=None)[source]

Initialize the model with given weights. :type A0: :param A0: Initial state matrix. :type A0: Tensor :type B0: :param B0: Initial input matrix. :type B0: Tensor :type C0: :param C0: Initial output matrix. :type C0: Tensor :type G0: :param G0: Initial disturbance matrix. :type G0: Tensor :param requires_grad: If True, gradients will be computed. :type requires_grad: bool

right_inverse_(A, B, C, G, gamma2, check=False)[source]

Method to initialize Parameter space from given weights

submersion_inv(A, G, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-05, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type G: :param G: Input disturbance matrix. :type G: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. Sigma (Tensor): Prescribed trace vector. C (Tensor): Output matrix. U (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nx * nx. Vt (Tensor): Orthogonal matrix of size nd * nd.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.ExoL2BoundedLinear(nu, ny, nx, nd, gamma, alpha=0.0, param='sqrtm', epsilon=1e-06)[source]

Bases: SSModel

Create a linear continuous-time state-space model with a prescribed L2 gain and alpha stability beween exogenous inputs d and the measured outputs y. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + B_dd\\
y &= Cx
Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • nx (int)

  • nd (int)

  • gamma (float)

  • alpha (float)

int

Number of states

int

nd

Number of exogenous inputs

Type:

int

gamma

L2 gain

Type:

float

alpha

alpha stability margin

Type:

float

param

Parameterization method (‘sqrtm’ or ‘ricccati’)

Type:

str

epsilon

Small positive number for positive definiteness

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, G0, gamma, alpha)[source]

This method enables to initialize the weights it is both a wrapper for irght_inverse and the not parameterized weights of the module

submersion_inv_lmi(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=0.0001, solver='MOSEK')[source]

This function computes the parameters Q, P, S, G and H by solving the LMI problem.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) P (Tensor): Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) H (Tensor): Matrix of shape (nx, nu) with orthogonal columns gamma_sys (float): Minimum gamma found in the LMI problem

Return type:

Q (Tensor)

submersion_inv_riccati(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=1e-08)[source]

This function computes the parameters P, G and S by solving the Riccati equation.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the Riccati equation of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx)

Return type:

P (Tensor)

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.ExoSSLinear(input_dim, output_dim, state_dim, dist_dim, alpha=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

A continuous-time linear state-space model with exogenous inputs : math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu + Gd \\
y &= Cx

where \(d\) is the exogenous input.

Attributes :

nu (int): number of inputs ny (int): number of outputs nx (int): number of states nd (int): number of exogenous inputs alpha (float, optional) : upper bound on decay rate of matrix A (necessarily Hurwitz)

Parameters:

  • input_dim (int)

  • output_dim (int)

  • state_dim (int)

  • dist_dim (int)

  • alpha (float | None)

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.FLNSSM(nu, ny, nx, linear_model, controller_type='output_feedback', nd=None, hidden_layers=[64, 64], act_f='relu', lip=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

A Feedforward Linearizable Neural Network State-Space Model (FLNSSM) that learns a linearizing controller for a given system. It can be an Output Feedback or State Feedback controller, depending on the inputs provided.

Parameters:

  • nu (int) – Number of inputs.

  • ny (int) – Number of outputs.

  • nx (int) – Number of states.

  • linear_model (Optional[SSModel], optional) – Linear model type to use as a reference model for the closed-loop system. Defaults to None.

  • controller_type (str, optional) – Type of controller to learn (‘output_feedback’ or ‘state_feedback’). Defaults to ‘output_feedback’.

  • nd (Optional[int]) – Number of disturbances/exogenous signals. Defaults to None.

  • hidden_layers (List[int]) – List of integers specifying the number of neurons in each hidden layer.

  • act_f (str, optional) – Activation function to use in the hidden layers. Defaults to ‘relu’.

  • lip (Optional[Union[float, Tensor]], optional) – Lipschitz constant upper bound for the MLPs. Defaults to None.

clone()[source]

Clone the FLNSSM model.

Returns:

A new instance of the FLNSSM model with the same parameters.

Return type:

FLNSSM

forward(u, x, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the FLNSSM model.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu).

  • x (Tensor) – State tensor of shape (batch_size, nx).

  • d (Optional[Tensor]) – Disturbance tensor of shape (batch_size, nd). Defaults to None.

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny), which is the output of the linear model.

Return type:

Tensor

init_weights_(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Initialize the weights of the linear model and the controller.

Parameters:

  • *args – Positional arguments for the linear model and controller.

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments for the linear model and controller.

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.GNSSM(nu, ny, nx, hidden_layers=[16], act_f='relu', out_eq_nl=False, alpha=None, bias=True, lin_model_type=None, lip=None, param='sqrtm', gamma=None, gamma2=None)[source]

Bases: SSModel

Class representing a Generalized Neural State-Space Model (GNSSM). ..math:

\dot{x} = Ax + Bu + f(x, u)
y = Cx + h(x)

where \(f\) and \(h\) are nonlinear functions approximated by neural networks. The linear part :math:`(A, B, C)`can be parameterized to have desired properties such as stability or finite gain.

Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • nx (int)

  • hidden_layers (List[int])

  • act_f (str)

  • out_eq_nl (bool)

  • alpha (float | None)

  • bias (bool)

  • lin_model_type (str | None)

  • lip (dict[str, float] | None)

  • param (str)

  • gamma (float | None)

  • gamma2 (float | None)

nu

Number of inputs.

Type:

int

ny

Number of outputs.

Type:

int

nx

Number of states.

Type:

int

hidden_layers

List of hidden layer sizes for the neural networks.

Type:

List[int]

act_f

Activation function used in the neural networks (‘tanh’ or ‘relu’) default is ‘relu’.

Type:

str

out_eq_nl

Whether to include a nonlinear output equation.

Type:

bool

alpha

Maximum decay rate for the linear part (A) (default is None, which means no decay constraint).

Type:

Optional[float]

bias

Whether to include bias terms in the neural networks.

Type:

bool

linmod

a submodule representing the linear part it can be parameterized

Type:

Module

clone()[source]

Clone the model, it has to be implemented to be compliant with simulator classes.

Return type:

GNSSM

forward(u, x, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the GNSSM.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor.

  • x (Tensor) – State tensor.

  • d (Tensor, optional) – Disturbance tensor. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Derivative of the state. y (Tensor): Output tensor.

Return type:

dx (Tensor)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, requires_grad=True, init_type='linear', margin=0.1)[source]

This method enables to initialize the weights it is both a wrapper for irght_inverse and the not parameterized weights of the module

Parameters:

init_type (str)

to_lure()[source]

Returns the Lur’e representation of the GNSSM: ẋ = Ax + B2 u + B1 φ(q) y = C2 x + D22 u + D21 φ(q) z = C1 x + D12 u + D11 φ(q) where φ(q) is the stacked nonlinear activation vector.

Return type:

Tuple[Tensor, ...]

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.H2Linear(nu, ny, nx, gamma_2)[source]

Bases: SSLinear

Create a linear continuous-time state-space model with a prescribed H2 norm. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu \\
y &= Cx
Parameters:

  • nu (int)

  • ny (int)

  • nx (int)

  • gamma_2 (float)

nu

Number of inputs.

Type:

int

ny

Number of outputs.

Type:

int

nx

Number of states.

Type:

int

gamma_2

Prescribed H2 norm.

Type:

float

check_(epsilon=1e-06)[source]

Check if the model has the correct H2 norm. :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float

Returns:

True if the model is valid, False otherwise. float: The H2 norm of the model.

Return type:

bool

clone()[source]

Clone the model. This method is called by the simulator to create a copy of the model. :returns: A copy of the model :rtype: SSLinear

classmethod copy(model)[source]

This class method returns a copy of a given H2bounded model.

We have to do this trick since self is not usable due to geotorch. Indeed when an object has parameterized attributes its class changes.

Return type:

H2Linear

Parameters:

model (H2Linear)

init_weights_(A0, B0, C0, requires_grad=True)[source]

Initialize the model with given weights. :type A0: :param A0: Initial state matrix. :type A0: Tensor :type B0: :param B0: Initial input matrix. :type B0: Tensor :type C0: :param C0: Initial output matrix. :type C0: Tensor :type requires_grad: :param requires_grad: If True, gradients will be computed. :type requires_grad: bool

right_inverse_(A, B, C, gamma2, check=False)[source]

Method to initialize Parameter space from given weights

submersion_inv(A, B, C, gamma2=None, epsilon=1e-07, solver='MOSEK', check=False)[source]

Inverse function from Weights space to parameter space.

The LMI to obtain the observability grammian of the system is solved using CVXPY. :type A: :param A: State matrix. :type A: Tensor :type B: :param B: Input matrix. :type B: Tensor :type C: :param C: Output matrix. :type C: Tensor :type gamma2: :param gamma2: Prescribed H2 norm. :type gamma2: float :type epsilon: :param epsilon: Tolerance for the check. :type epsilon: float :type solver: :param solver: Solver to use for the LMI problem. :type solver: str :type check: :param check: If True, check the feasibility of the problem. :type check: bool

Returns:

Inverse of the observability grammian. S (Tensor): Skew-symetric matrix. M (Tensor): Prescrjbed trace matrix. C (Tensor): Output matrix.

Return type:

Wo_inv (Tensor)

Raises:

ValueError – If the LMI problem is infeasible or unbounded.

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.ILOFController(nu, ny, hidden_layers, act_f='relu', nd=None, lip=None)[source]

Bases: Module

Inverse of a Linearizing Output Feedback (ILOF) controller : .. math:

v = u + lpha(y)

or .. math:

v = u + lpha(y, d)

if disturbances are present.

\(lpha\) is a function approximating the linearizing controller. and v is the new virtual input to the closed-loop system.

Parameters:

  • nu (int) – Number of inputs.

  • ny (int) – Number of outputs.

  • hidden_layers (List[int]) – List of integers specifying the number of neurons in each hidden layer

  • act_f (str, optional) – Activation function to use in the hidden layers. Defaults to ‘relu’.

  • nd (Optional[int], optional) – Number of disturbances/exogenous signals. Defaults to

  • lip (optional) – Lipschitz constant upper bound for the controller. Defaults to None.

clone()[source]

Clone the ILOF controller.

Returns:

A new instance of the ILOF controller with the same parameters.

Return type:

ILOFController

forward(u, y, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the ILOF controller.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu).

  • y (Tensor) – Output tensor of shape (batch_size, ny).

  • d (Optional[Tensor]) – Disturbance tensor of shape (batch_size, nd). Defaults to None.

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (batch_size, nu), which is the new virtual input.

Return type:

Tensor

class ctrlnmod.models.ssmodels.continuous.ILSFController(nu, nx, hidden_layers, act_f='relu', nd=None, lip=None)[source]

Bases: Module

Inverse of a Linearizing State Feedback (ILSF) controller : .. math:

v = u + lpha(x)

or .. math:

v = u + lpha(x, d)

if disturbances are present.

\(lpha\) is a function approximating the linearizing controller. and v is the new virtual input to the closed-loop system.

Parameters:

  • nu (int) – Number of inputs.

  • nx (int) – Number of states.

  • hidden_layers (List[int]) – List of integers specifying the number of neurons in each hidden layer

  • act_f (str, optional) – Activation function to use in the hidden layers. Defaults to ‘relu’.

  • nd (Optional[int], optional) – Number of disturbances/exogenous signals. Defaults to None.

  • lip (optional) – Lipschitz constant upper bound for the controller. Defaults to None.

clone()[source]

Clone the ILSF controller.

Returns:

A new instance of the ILSF controller with the same parameters.

Return type:

ILSFController

forward(u, x, d=None)[source]

Forward pass of the ILSF controller.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (batch_size, nu).

  • x (Tensor) – State tensor of shape (batch_size, nx).

  • d (Optional[Tensor]) – Disturbance tensor of shape (batch_size, nd). Defaults to None.

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (batch_size, nu), which is the new virtual input.

Tensor

submersion_inv_lmi(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=0.0001, solver='MOSEK')[source]

This function computes the parameters Q, P, S, G and H by solving the LMI problem.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) P (Tensor): Solution to the LMI problem of shape (nx, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) H (Tensor): Matrix of shape (nx, nu) with orthogonal columns gamma_sys (float): Minimum gamma found in the LMI problem

Return type:

Q (Tensor)

submersion_inv_riccati(A, B, C, gamma, epsilon=1e-08)[source]

This function computes the parameters P, G and S by solving the Riccati equation.

Parameters:

  • A (Tensor) – State matrix of shape (nx, nx)

  • B (Tensor) – Input matrix of shape (nx, nu)

  • C (Tensor) – Output matrix of shape (ny, nx)

  • gamma (float) – L2 gain

  • epsilon (float) – Small positive number for numerical stability

Returns:

Solution to the Riccati equation of shape (nx, nx) G (Tensor): Matrix of shape (ny, nx) S (Tensor): Skew-symmetric matrix of shape (nx, nx)

Return type:

P (Tensor)

A continuous-time linear state-space model without exogenous inputs and direct trerm : .. math:

\dot{x} &= Ax + Bu \\
y &= Cx
Attributes :

  • output_dim (int)

  • state_dim (int)
